meanings.definition: To plan together secretly to commit an illegal or wrongful act.
meanings.sent1: The villains conspire to steal the precious jewels from the museum.
meanings.sent2: The criminals conspire to rob the bank under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cats conspire to open the treat jar when no one is looking.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds and strong winds seem to conspire against our outdoor picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: In the shadows, the spies conspire to overthrow the government in a daring plot.

meanings.definition: To act in harmony toward a common end.
meanings.sent1: The birds and the bees seem to conspire to pollinate the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The team members conspire to win the championship by practicing diligently.
meanings.sent3: The ingredients in the recipe conspire to create a delicious and mouthwatering dish.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky conspire to create a breathtaking view for stargazers.
meanings.sent5: The waves and the wind conspire to guide the sailboat safely back to shore.
